cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then accelerate north-northeast, making landfall in Florida’s Big-Bend Thursday, cross Georgia/Carolinas and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic, tracking east-northeast away from the U.S. East Coast during the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch westward to Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Florida through the Carolinas and portions of the Mid-Atlantic coast, including offshore New Jersey/New York waters
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts to 40 mph possible late weekend if the storm tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York & New Jersey given current offshore track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late weekend, locally higher if the center passes closer.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey and Long Island beaches beginning this weekend.
